docs.lead_paragraph: The Trail Blazers huddled in a timeout with just more than 17 seconds left against Oklahoma City, and the overwhelming sentiment was simple: relax.

docs.lead_paragraph: Rival Kurdish groups clashed in Iraq's northwestern Sinjar region on Friday, two Kurdish security sources said.

docs.lead_paragraph: When street-gang thieves slipped with ease into a Norfolk Southern rail yard on Chicago's South Side and ripped locks off one train, they likely expected to see merchandise like toys or tennis shoes. What they beheld instead was a gangster's jackpot: box after box of brand new guns.

headline.main: Gangs Reap Guns From Trains in Violent Chicago Neighborhoods
headline.print_headline: Gangs Reap Guns From Trains in Violent Chicago Neighborhoods

docs.lead_paragraph: Nick Kyrgios served like a demon to bounce Serbia's world number two and top seed Novak Djokovic out of the quarter-finals of the Acapulco International with a 7-6(9) 7-5 victory on Thursday.

headline.main: Ace High Kyrgios Stuns Djokovic in Acapulco
headline.print_headline: Ace High Kyrgios Stuns Djokovic in Acapulco

docs.lead_paragraph: Growth in Ireland's services sector slipped slightly in February but remained close to January's post-Brexit high and confidence about the future continued to grow, a survey showed on Friday.

headline.print_headline: Irish Services Sector Slips Back From Post-Brexit High-PMI

docs.lead_paragraph: A major assault on the Islamic State group's self-proclaimed capital of Raqqa is expected to begin in the coming weeks, but various military forces eyeing the northern Syrian city are bitterly divided.

docs.lead_paragraph: Japan's core consumer prices rose for the first time in over a year in January thanks to a pickup in energy costs, but a slump in household spending showed why economic growth and inflation have lagged the more ambitious goals set out by policymakers.

headline.main: Japan Consumer Prices Rise for First Time in Year but BOJ Goal Still Distant
headline.print_headline: Japan Consumer Prices Rise for First Time in Year but BOJ Goal Still Distant

docs.lead_paragraph: After the battlefield of Iraq's Mosul, the next major campaign against the Islamic State group will be to take its de facto capital, the Syrian city of Raqqa. The Pentagon has drawn up a secret plan to do that, likely leaning on local allies with stepped up American support.

headline.main: Rivals in Syria Race to Assault Militants' 'Capital' Raqqa
headline.print_headline: Rivals in Syria Race to Assault Militants' 'Capital' Raqqa

docs.lead_paragraph: A former Utah attorney general was found not guilty on Thursday of bribery and corruption charges after he was accused in a pay-to-play graft scandal, media said.
